channel.title: [317] Player Dialogue and NpcDialogue [317]
channel.description:
Tutorial: Npc Dialogue Difficulty: Depends on your copy and paste skills. Base: Tested on Delta and some other 317's. Before you start: Have a backup for your files incase you get a 100 error. Lets start ;D [b][size=16pt]Step 1:[/size][/b] Open up your client.java Search: case 123 you should find something like this:
case 123: talk2("You do not have a task.", "Talk to me in Edgeville when you get one.", 1597); break;
[b]Now add under your last case case ****, depending what your last case is, if your last case is 123, then add 124.[/b] [u][b]Explaining the code:[/b][/u] [code]case 123: talk2("You do not have a task.", "Talk to me in Edgeville when you get one.", 1597);[/code] This is saying that if the case ID is 123, the npc 1597 will talk. [code]break;[/code] I think this stops it from keeping the Dialogue repeating, correct me if I'm wrong.. [size=16pt] [b]Step 2:[/b][/size] Now add what you want for your case to say remember to change the 1597 code to your npcID and replace your caseID to your last case number. Now, if you want to keep adding dialogue its fine. [size=16pt][b]Step 3: Player Dialgoue[/b][/size] Search for:
public void talk2
You should find something like this: [code] public void talk2(String text, String text2, int npc) { sendFrame200(4901, 591); sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4902); sendFrame126("", 4903); sendFrame126(text, 4904); sendFrame126(text2, 4905); sendFrame126("", 4906); sendFrame75(npc, 4901); sendFrame164(4900); } [/code] Add under it: [code] public void playertalk(String text, String text2) { sendFrame200(974,595); sendFrame126(playerName, 975); sendFrame126(text, 976); sendFrame126(text2, 977); sendFrame185(974); sendFrame164(973); NpcDialogueSend = true; }[/code] [b] Now to make your player talk go back to your cases and add under it:[/b] [code] YOURCASEID: playertalk("What your player wants to say Here", "AND HERE"); break;[/code] [size=16pt][b]Step 4:search 1552 and you should find something like this:[/b][/size] [code]if(NPCID == 1552 && playerRights > 1){ NpcDialogue = 111; NpcDialogueSend = false; } }[/code] or search something like: [code]NPCID ==[/code] you should find it. [b]Explaining the code:[/b] [code]if(NPCID == 1552 && playerRights > 1){[/code] If the NPCID is 1552 and the player rights is more than 1, then.. Note: if you want to make it 1 and more instead only more than 1, then switch:
<
to [code]<=[/code] [code] NpcDialogue = 111; NpcDialogueSend = false;[/code] NpcID is 111, NpcDialogueSend = false; - stops the dialogue from bugging/glitching. [code] }[/code] Ends the code. [size=16pt][b]Step 5:[/b][/size] [b]Search in your client.java[/b] [code]111[/code] Untill you find something like this. [code] if (NpcDialogue == 1 || NpcDialogue == 2|| NpcDialogue == 3 || NpcDialogue == 4 || NpcDialogue == 5 || NpcDialogue == 6 || NpcDialogue == 8 || NpcDialogue == 10 || NpcDialogue == 13 || NpcDialogue == 16 || NpcDialogue == 18 || NpcDialogue == 19 || NpcDialogue == 21 || NpcDialogue == 22 || NpcDialogue == 23 || NpcDialogue == 27 || NpcDialogue == 28 || NpcDialogue == 30 || NpcDialogue == 31 || NpcDialogue == 32 || NpcDialogue == 34 || NpcDialogue == 37 || NpcDialogue == 41 || NpcDialogue == 42 || NpcDialogue == 44 || NpcDialogue == 45 || NpcDialogue == 48 || NpcDialogue == 49 || NpcDialogue == 139 || NpcDialogue == 50 || NpcDialogue == 52 || NpcDialogue == 54 || NpcDialogue == 57 || NpcDialogue == 60 || NpcDialogue == 64 || NpcDialogue == 65 || NpcDialogue == 66 || NpcDialogue == 73 || NpcDialogue == 75 || NpcDialogue == 77 || NpcDialogue == 81 || NpcDialogue == 82 || NpcDialogue == 83 || NpcDialogue == 85 || NpcDialogue == 87 || NpcDialogue == 91 || NpcDialogue == 89 || NpcDialogue == 90 || NpcDialogue == 91 || NpcDialogue == 92 || NpcDialogue == 95 || NpcDialogue == 96 || NpcDialogue == 97 || NpcDialogue == 98 || NpcDialogue == 100 || NpcDialogue == 102 || NpcDialogue == 103 || NpcDialogue == 105 || NpcDialogue == 106 || NpcDialogue == 107 || NpcDialogue == 108 || NpcDialogue == 109 || NpcDialogue == 111 || NpcDialogue == 112 || NpcDialogue == 114 || NpcDialogue == 116 || NpcDialogue == 124 [/code] Simply add next to it your case ID's that you added. Explaining the code: [code]if(NpcDialogue[/code] - If the Npc Dialogue. [code]==[/code] - is [code]1[/code] - specific number of the written dialogue. [u][b]Your are now done.. Creditz: Me, Delta, Moparscape for its amazing forum..[/b][/u] [b]Other tutorials:[/b] [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,429738.40.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,429738.40.html[/url] - How to make a 317 PvP area-Delta. Extra Information!: NOTE: Every Dialogue you do you must skip 2 cases for example: You just added these dialogues [code] || NpcDialogue == 124 || NpcDialogue == 125[/code] Add this: [code] || NpcDialogue == 127 || NpcDialogue == 128[/code] Notice how i skipped two dialogues its cause if you dont do this the Npc will keep saying the dialogues for example, you made santa talk and some other npc too, if you dont skip santa will say the other npc's lines. [b]Comment, rate, rep or i will have to remove it![/b] [b] Thank you:[/b] [b]Runewings317[/b] [b]RuneSpace[/b] Special Thanks to: [b]Usman555[/b]

item.title: [317] Player Dialogue and NpcDialogue [317]
item.dc:creator: @Kecea Kecea
item.description:
@Kecea wrote:

Good tutorial; more dialogues and less commands in the future, please.

Seeing as packet 40 could have a nextDialogue variable instead:

case 40: if (nextDialogue == -1) { closeAll(); } else { sendDialogue(nextDialogue); } break;

You get the idea? Nothing but the way I like doing it - the most important thing is that it works, imo.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Player Dialogue and NpcDialogue [317]
item.dc:creator: @123kdd100 123kdd100
item.description:
@123kdd100 wrote:

[quote=“570fd, post:18, topic:367770”]Ok i have understand theese
just 1 question…
I made the dialogue that make’s teleport. it got two options
example it says where u wanna tele
duel arena
caste wars
And how do i do it teleport’s
or other option
I mean i need example how to make two options working[/quote]
Easy,
go to clickingMost.java
Search Case 9158:
You should find under that a list of dialogues, simply add your choice dialogue there.
Above that add:

if(c.NpcDialogue == DIALOGUENUMBER){
c.closeAll();
c.triggerTele(X, Y, HeightLevel);
c.killMyNPCs();
c.resetfollowers(); 
}

Your welcome
Oh and under that you can add your other choice (2nd one on the list) wich is castle wars i belive.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Player Dialogue and NpcDialogue [317]
item.dc:creator: @123kdd100 123kdd100
item.description:
@123kdd100 wrote:

[quote=“rova1, post:16, topic:367770”][quote author=123kdd100 link=topic=463918.msg3444093#msg3444093 date=1293291815]

1 isn’t 1 or more, >= 1 is

Its the same thing, > and >=, i use both and have no errors
[/quote]

No, it’s not the same thing. It wouldn’t give you an error because there’s no mistake in the code, but there will be a small effect.

In the context you’re using it:

playerRights > 1 means players with rights 2, 3, 4 only
playerRights >= 1 means players with rights 1, 2, 3 and 4

means greater than
= means greater than or equal to

just helping you understand the difference…[/quote]
Thanks, updated.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Player Dialogue and NpcDialogue [317]
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

[quote=“123kdd100, post:15, topic:367770”][quote author=Muroth link=topic=463918.msg3428984#msg3428984 date=1292173263]

1 isn’t 1 or more, >= 1 is
[/quote]
Its the same thing, > and >=, i use both and have no errors[/quote]

No, it’s not the same thing. It wouldn’t give you an error because there’s no mistake in the code, but there will be a small effect.

In the context you’re using it:

playerRights > 1 means players with rights 2, 3, 4 only
playerRights >= 1 means players with rights 1, 2, 3 and 4

means greater than
= means greater than or equal to

just helping you understand the difference…

Read full topic

c.closeAll();
}
break;

My Npc choice code in clickingmost is :

if (c.NpcDialogue == 20) { c.closeAll(); c.toX = 2730; c.toY = 9183; }

Hope you can help me. (I realy added everthing what a choice need , But maby i need to add more becaus this is the first choice in the sourch maded)[/quote]

item.title: [317] Player Dialogue and NpcDialogue [317]
item.dc:creator: @123kdd100 123kdd100
item.description:
@123kdd100 wrote:

Tutorial: Npc Dialogue
Difficulty: Depends on your copy and paste skills.
Base: Tested on Delta and some other 317’s.
Before you start:
Have a backup for your files incase you get a 100 error.
Lets start ;D

[size=16pt]Step 1:[/size]
Open up your client.java
Search: case 123
you should find something like this:

case 123: talk2("You do not have a task.", "Talk to me in Edgeville when you get one.", 1597); break;

Now add under your last case
case ****, depending what your last case is, if your last case is 123, then add 124.

Explaining the code:

case 123: talk2("You do not have a task.", "Talk to me in Edgeville when you get one.", 1597);
This is saying that if the case ID is 123, the npc 1597 will talk.

break;

I think this stops it from keeping the Dialogue repeating, correct me if I’m wrong…
[size=16pt]
Step 2:[/size]
Now add what you want for your case to say remember to change the 1597 code to your npcID and replace your caseID to your last case number.
Now, if you want to keep adding dialogue its fine.

[size=16pt]Step 3: Player Dialgoue[/size]
Search for:

public void talk2
You should find something like this: [code] public void talk2(String text, String text2, int npc) { sendFrame200(4901, 591); sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npc), 4902); sendFrame126("", 4903); sendFrame126(text, 4904); sendFrame126(text2, 4905); sendFrame126("", 4906); sendFrame75(npc, 4901); sendFrame164(4900); } [/code]

Add under it:

public void playertalk(String text, String text2) { sendFrame200(974,595); sendFrame126(playerName, 975); sendFrame126(text, 976); sendFrame126(text2, 977); sendFrame185(974); sendFrame164(973); NpcDialogueSend = true; }

Now to make your player talk go back to your cases and add under it:

YOURCASEID: playertalk("What your player wants to say Here", "AND HERE"); break;

[size=16pt]Step 4:search 1552 and you should find something like this:[/size]

if(NPCID == 1552 && playerRights > 1){ NpcDialogue = 111; NpcDialogueSend = false; } }
or search something like: NPCID ==
you should find it.

Explaining the code:

if(NPCID == 1552 && playerRights > 1){

If the NPCID is 1552 and the player rights is more than 1, then…
Note: if you want to make it 1 and more instead only more than 1, then switch:

<
to [code]<=[/code]

NpcDialogue = 111; NpcDialogueSend = false;
NpcID is 111,
NpcDialogueSend = false; - stops the dialogue from bugging/glitching.

}
Ends the code.

[size=16pt]Step 5:[/size]

Search in your client.java

111

Untill you find something like this.

			if (NpcDialogue == 1 || NpcDialogue == 2|| NpcDialogue == 3 || NpcDialogue == 4  || NpcDialogue == 5  || NpcDialogue == 6  || NpcDialogue == 8 || NpcDialogue == 10 || NpcDialogue == 13 || NpcDialogue == 16 || NpcDialogue == 18 || NpcDialogue == 19 || NpcDialogue == 21 || NpcDialogue == 22 || NpcDialogue == 23 || NpcDialogue == 27 || NpcDialogue == 28 || NpcDialogue == 30 || NpcDialogue == 31 || NpcDialogue == 32 || NpcDialogue == 34 || NpcDialogue == 37 || NpcDialogue == 41 || NpcDialogue == 42 || NpcDialogue == 44 || NpcDialogue == 45 || NpcDialogue == 48 || NpcDialogue == 49 || NpcDialogue == 139 || NpcDialogue == 50 || NpcDialogue == 52 || NpcDialogue == 54 || NpcDialogue == 57 || NpcDialogue == 60 || NpcDialogue == 64 || NpcDialogue == 65 || NpcDialogue == 66 || NpcDialogue == 73 || NpcDialogue == 75 || NpcDialogue == 77 || NpcDialogue == 81 || NpcDialogue == 82 || NpcDialogue == 83 || NpcDialogue == 85 || NpcDialogue == 87 || NpcDialogue == 91 || NpcDialogue == 89 || NpcDialogue == 90 || NpcDialogue == 91 || NpcDialogue == 92 || NpcDialogue == 95 || NpcDialogue == 96 || NpcDialogue == 97 || NpcDialogue == 98 || NpcDialogue == 100 || NpcDialogue == 102 || NpcDialogue == 103 || NpcDialogue == 105 || NpcDialogue == 106 || NpcDialogue == 107 || NpcDialogue == 108 || NpcDialogue == 109 || NpcDialogue == 111 || NpcDialogue == 112 || NpcDialogue == 114 || NpcDialogue == 116 || NpcDialogue == 124

Simply add next to it your case ID’s that you added.
Explaining the code:

if(NpcDialogue - If the Npc Dialogue.

== - is

1 - specific number of the written dialogue.
Your are now done…
Creditz: Me, Delta, Moparscape for its amazing forum…

Other tutorials:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,429738.40.html - How to make a 317 PvP area-Delta.

Extra Information!:
NOTE: Every Dialogue you do you must skip 2 cases for example:
You just added these dialogues

 || NpcDialogue == 124 || NpcDialogue == 125

Add this:

 || NpcDialogue == 127 || NpcDialogue == 128

Notice how i skipped two dialogues its cause if you dont do this the Npc will keep saying the dialogues for example, you made santa talk and some other npc too, if you dont skip santa will say the other npc’s lines.

Comment, rate, rep or i will have to remove it!


Thank you:
Runewings317
RuneSpace

Special Thanks to:
Usman555

Read full topic
